title: (x) Heavy serif from Rand McNally maps - Romana {Mark S}
content:
Hi,

I’m trying to identify this serif face, it appears on Rand McNally maps from the 80s in various widths. Maybe a simple id.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081005112930im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cawus.jpg)

Thanks in advance,  
Richard

 [‹ (x) TrendyWeb.omgheadshot.com - Yanone Kaffeesatz {Marc O}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081005112930/http:/typophile.com/node/17863 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Predigital fonts - various {gang} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081005112930/http:/typophile.com/node/17806 "Go to next forum topic")
author: richardm

comments.content: It’s a version of Romana. It doesn’t quite match the samples [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081005112930/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=romana) because there were a number of different versions. I would guess that the one in your sample was a film font version from the seventies.
